title: BitGoba
author: BitGoba
content: As a bitcoin enthusiast I started this directoryhttps://spend-sats.comIf you know stores and services that accept sats, feel free to add them to the directory

comments.author: decodx
comments.body: Quote from: BitGoba on September 29, 2023, 09:55:14 PM<...>When did you start that directory?Â  I noticed there are only 17 online stores listed at the moment. It might be a good idea to think about adding more stores to make it more helpful for users. You can expand your information sources by checking out sites like BitPay's directory or CoinGate's list. And, of course, don't forget the power of a good old Google search. Don't be lazy. Do your own research!

comments.author: Husires
comments.body: design is good and the existing list is small that may need some updating, but why do I need to pay to vote for the service? Voting for the service is not useful to me, even if it is a Satoshi, someone can do it, and it may be misused.a scam company may request that its name be added. It pays 10k satoshi to appear as if it is a reliable company. The opposite may happen, which is to vote negatively for a competing service

comments.author: Yamane_Keto
comments.body: It is not difficult to create a list, as the data available in this forum that can be collected from members is large, but in how to keep the list up to date. You need to test it continuously at least once a month and delete or add any modification that occurs to the service, which means more work, especially if the list is huge. If you continue to keep it up to date and comprehensive, the site will succeed, but it requires a lot of activity.if you searching in this forum and Google will give you huge lists, which you will test and update.

comments.author: Saint-loup
comments.body: The website is clear and minimalist, allowing to find the information quickly, I like that. I discovered several services that I didn't known they were accepting Bitcoin payments, it's a good thing because I am always happy to use my Bitcoin for buying something in real life which is for what Bitcoin has been designed at first. Unfortunately your gambling section is very poor and you don't list casinos with the best reputation(like 1xbet) I think you could look at the Gambling section of the forum to find some good ones to add. The one I'm promoting in my signature(Livecasino) could deserve it for example IMO. Anyway thank you for sharing it here, that's a nice service.
